caption.p: Attenuation and reversion mutations in the IAV polymerase complex. Attenuation mutations in the IAV polymerase: The locations of various IAV mutations found in the MDV LAIV and in revertant strains are shown as CPK spheres on the background of the polymerase complex colored as in Figure 2, with some subunits being shown as surfaces and others as cartoons in various orientations as needed for clarity. A dynamic version of this figure where the molecules can be rotated in real time is available on-lines as Figure S2. Mutations in the US LAIV MDV A/Ann Arbor/6/60 H2N2 are shown in red. Mutations present in the Russian LAIV MDV Len/17 or Len/47 (A/Leningrad/134/57 H2N2) strain are shown in magenta or blue, respectively. PB2 mutations V478L (Len/17) and S490R (Len/47) are not indicated in the structure. For more information see Figure 2 and Table 1. A set of engineered mutations in the PA subunit linker segment that wraps around PB1 are shown in green. Reversion mutations in PB1 (E51K, I171V) and PA (N350K) that restore virulence in the US LAIV MDV A/Ann Arbor/6/60 H2N2 ( Table 2, green) are shown in orange.
